entity.name: Countryfile
entity.description: Stories are shared of the people, places and issues at the heart of the British countryside. Popular features include the programme's photography contest, which culminates in a yearly calendar sold to benefit charity, the Video Diary, produced by viewers and focused on life in rural areas, and the weather forecasts.

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile Diaries
entity.description: A sister show to the BBC's `Countryfile' series, this rural affairs programme sees a team of presenters travel the length and breadth of the United Kingdom to cover stories related to the British countryside and the season of spring. As this period is a busy time of the year for the farming and outdoor communities in particular, regular topics covered include the production of food, nature conservation, and a look at a chosen area's culture and history. Stunning landscapes and a variety of wildlife also feature prominently.

@FromeGateway @GavinBridgeUK @SpatiaUK @EnvAgency @BristolOneCity @BristolCouncil @HTADesignLLP @AYSouthWestView @ArupGroup By all means keep churning out the images but just keep in mind people work in this area supporting families - in my client’s case that’s +100 people families and they wonder if their profession is being destroyed.

Can I also add they have deliveries from well outside the local area such as north Wales and Manchester which have massively polluting lorries carrying all that stuff . @EnvAgencyMids have allowed them to increase the number of lorries and the tonnage to increase from 250,000

@FromeGateway @GavinBridgeUK @SpatiaUK @EnvAgency @BristolOneCity @BristolCouncil @HTADesignLLP @AYSouthWestView @ArupGroup We appreciate the sentiment of redevelopment and don’t doubt that the area needs a lift but you cannot ignore existing business or the industrial/warehouse/last mile delivery market creating the majority of jobs.

I’ve never seen one comment or image showing employment related options. My client based in the made demise of FG employs +50 members of locally skilled staff feels ignored and has never been contacted about this utopian dream.

The two systems affecting the S of the UK today show up nicely on this graph of the past 24 hours rainfall, from an @EnvAgency gauge located on South Dartmoor. 

Steady rain associated with the frontal system overnight, followed by more sporadic showers with brief heavy bursts. https://t.co/sjhqqVVLyI
